abstract: Michael Bloomberg will resume leadership of his business empire. | Proposed rule to reduce risk of derivatives. | A troubled housing market in Ferguson, Mo. | High-ranking prosecutor leaving Justice Department.
snippet: Michael Bloomberg will resume leadership of his business empire. | Proposed rule to reduce risk of derivatives. | A troubled housing market in Ferguson, Mo. | High-ranking prosecutor leaving Justice Department.
lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg has decided to resume the leadership of his business empire only eight months after ending his final term as mayor of New York, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in The New York Times. On Wednesday, Mr. Bloomberg told close confidants and senior executives of Bloomberg L.P., a financial data and media company, that Daniel L. Doctoroff, its chief executive and a longtime friend and lieutenant, would leave the company at the end of the year and that he would take over.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Bloomberg Returning to His Company
